meanings.definition: A feeling of resentment or ill-will
meanings.sent1: She held a grutch against her friend for forgetting her birthday.
meanings.sent2: His grutch towards his boss affected his work performance.
meanings.sent3: Despite their grutch, they managed to work together on the project.
meanings.sent4: The grutch between the neighbors escalated into a heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The grutch in her heart slowly turned into forgiveness over time.

meanings.sent1: He would grutch about the long hours at work every day.
meanings.sent2: She tends to grutch whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The child would grutch about having to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Don't just grutch, try to find a solution to the problem.
meanings.sent5: His constant grutching was starting to annoy his friends.

meanings.sent1: She lodged a grutch with the customer service department.
meanings.sent2: His grutch about the poor service was heard by the manager.
meanings.sent3: The grutch in the suggestion box made the team rethink their approach.
meanings.sent4: The grutch in the meeting was quickly addressed by the team leader.
meanings.sent5: Her grutch was resolved after a sincere apology from the company.
